subject: Re: [junit] expensive setup which is definitely only required  once
msgSnippet: Can you explain why is 1. better? Let say I want to test some higher granularity methods like csv.findDuplicates() csv.convertToXML() csv.calcStatistics() how
messageBody:
Can you explain why is 1. better?

Let say I want to test some higher granularity methods like

csv.findDuplicates()
csv.convertToXML()
csv.calcStatistics()

how would you propose to do it without reading a CSV file?

Wai Yip


--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
> Two things.
>
> 1. Think about how to change your design so that your test doesn't need to
> read/write CSV files. This is the better option of the two I offer you.
> 2. If you really can't do (1), then look at TestSetup for information about
> one-time setup.
>
> Good luck.
>
> So said jakespigl3 on 4/7/2003 --------------------
> Hi,
>
> Being new to junit and the world of unit testing, how do I eliminate
> part of the setup from being torn down and setup again for each test?
> It seems like a bit of a waste of time.
>
> The part of the setup I am talking about is writing a csv file for the
> purposes of getting the class under test to read it. There will be a
> test case to write a report too - based on the contents of the file.
> There will only be one test case to test the read functionality.
>
> How do should I proceed?
>
> regards
> jfc
>
>
>
>
>
